Also "Знайка" appears later: "Знайке" (invited). So "Знайка" is same person? Likely same person, maybe male? But "Знайкина" is female? Wait, "Знайкина" could be possessive of "Знайкина" (female). But "Знайка" is a nickname? Could be same person. The text: "Знайка приехал". So "Знайка" is a person. The book is by "Знайкина". So maybe "Знайкина" is the author, female, and "Знайка" is the same person? But the text uses "Знайка" as a person, maybe male. But we cannot assume gender. The name "Знайка" could be male or female. But "Знайкина" is possessive of "Знайка" (like "Znaika's book"). In Russian, possessive of a male name ends with -а? Actually for male names, possessive is -а: e.g., "Иванов" -> "Иванова". For female names, possessive is -ой: e.g., "Мария" -> "Марии". So "Знайкина" could be possessive of "Знайкин" (male). So "Знайкин" is male. But the text says "Эта Знайкина книжка". So "Знайкин" is male. Then "Знайка" is a nickname for "Знайкин". So same person. So we have one character: Знайкин (male). But we need canonical name without title. So "Знайкин". Aliases: "Знайка". Also "Знайкина" is possessive, but we can include as alias? The rule: alias must be same character. So we can include "Знайка" and "Знайкина" as alias forms. But "Знайкина" is possessive, not a name. But we can include it as alias? The rule: alias is name variant found in text. "Знайкина" is a variant. So include.

But rule says include only if clearly refers to same single person. In this text, only professor mentioned is Звёздочкин. So "профессор" refers to him. So we can include alias "профессор". But we need example sentence for each alias. Provide short sentence containing this form. So we need to provide example sentences from text. But we need example sentence containing the alias form. For "профессор" we can use "профессор Звёздочкин" but that includes the name. But we can use "профессор" alone? But we also have "профессор Звёздочкин" repeated. So alias list can include "профессор Звёздочкин" and maybe "профессор". But we don't have example sentence for "профессор" alone. But the alias "профессор" is not present alone. So we skip.
